thread.title: Wacky regatta sails into Key Largo
thread.title_full: Wacky regatta sails into Key Largo | www.palmbeachpost.com

author: Mary Thurwachter
title: Wacky regatta sails into Key Largo
text:
Resourceful crews of two or more will test their boat-making and endurance skills on Aug. 15 in Key Largo’s annual Anything That Floats Race. Boats are made of anything that won’t sink, from floatable flotsam like PVC, buckets, pool noodles and lawn furniture.
Teams paddle through Blackwater Sound during the ½-mile dash through a buoyed course between the Caribbean Club and Sundowner restaurant at mile marker 104 bayside.
Kristyn, left, and George Silver paddle their Coke float watercraft in last year’s Anything That Floats Race in Key Largo. This year’s race is Aug. 15. Photo by Bob Care of the Florida Keys News Bureau To propel themselves, teams use oars, paddles, arm power or may even hoist old T-shirts as a sail.
The race, which is free to watch, begins at 3 p.m. and is followed by a celebration. For more information, visit www.keylargoanythingthatfloatsrace.com .
</span
